head.title: Fire at Orphanage In Sarajevo Kills 5

hedline.hl1: Fire at Orphanage In Sarajevo Kills 5

block.p: A fire in a downtown orphanage in Sarajevo, Bosnia's capital, killed five babies and injured 19 others on Sunday, the chief prosecutor's office said.

The fire broke out in a third floor room of the Ljubica Izevic children's home shortly before 6 a.m., said Dubravko Champara of the prosecutor's office. While fire crews were able to put out the blaze rapidly, he said, three boys and two girls died from the effects of smoke inhalation.
A fire in a downtown orphanage in Sarajevo, Bosnia's capital, killed five babies and injured 19 others on Sunday, the chief prosecutor's office said.

The fire broke out in a third floor room of the Ljubica Izevic children's home shortly before 6 a.m., said Dubravko Champara of the prosecutor's office. While fire crews were able to put out the blaze rapidly, he said, three boys and two girls died from the effects of smoke inhalation.

A nurse who had tried to save some of the babies was also injured, with burns to the arms and face, Mr. Champara said in a telephone interview. Nineteen others were being treated for smoke inhalation and were not thought to be in critical condition, he said.

Correction: April 24, 2007, Tuesday Because of an editing error, a brief article yesterday about a deadly orphanage fire in the Bosnian capital of Sarajevo referred incorrectly in some copies to the location of Ljubljana, the city in the dateline, where the article was reported and written. It is in Slovenia, not Slovakia.
